course.subject: SOSC
course.name: Understanding Society
course.description: This course will help students appreciate the power of the sociological imagination in understanding their everyday lives. This is an age in which we tend to explain human behavior in terms of our individual achievements, personalities, and even our genetic make-up. The sociologist, however, looks at human behavior as the product of groups, organizations and culture. In order to master this sociological outlook, the course shall examine a number of topics central to our lives from the point of view of sociological perspectives and methods. These topics will include: culture, deviance, inequality, religion, education, social change and development, gender, intimate relations and the family, and power and politics.

reviews.author: illiteracy
reviews.title: [發泄文]
reviews.comment_content:
[發泄文]

Midterm前內容幾有趣 (文化, 身份, 越軌),
Midterm後係屎(貧窮, 性別).

都係個句: 1字頭common core內容難極有限, 大部份野都係聽完得個"哦"字

Midterm前內容又有趣, 上堂又會得閒玩下class experiment, 係唔錯既, 但係Midterm後好似換撚左人教咁, 內容又悶, 又無左class experiment, 講既野又以偏概全, 求其比一兩個例子你就話全部野都係咁, 夾硬塞比你去接受, 尤其係性別個部份. 大佬好心你教啲咁有爭議性既topic就唔好比一兩個例子就隨便落定論啦.

tl;dr: midterm前教得幾好, midterm後上堂度日如年.

reviews.author: wtever
reviews.comment_content: Content includes intro of sociology, family, crime and deviance, gender, politics, poverty, education. The content are of suitable difficulty as an introductory course to sociology with reasonable elaboration and ideas of each topic. Notes are provided, hard copies provided in the beginning of the semester. Notes are also uploaded to canvas. There are reading materials for each topic and supplementary PowerPoint slides about the verbal elaboration of notes in class. Lecture videos are provided as well.
reviews.comment_teaching: Her teaching is very good as she elaborates her notes very detailedly with many examples. She speaks good English. She plays videos in classes which are tested in midterm exam but not final exam. She also invites students to answers questions in the in class exercises.
reviews.comment_grading: Midterm got 0.3 sd above mean. Final exam got 0.3 sd below mean. Essay grade is not announced. Finished all inclass exercises. Got B+ at last.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is quite light. There is no assignment. The professor doesn't take attendance but there are in-class exercises to do after watching videos that account for attendance. One 600 to 1000 word essay is required to submit at the beginning of December. It is of free title chosen from topics taught, including intro of sociology, crime and deviance, family, gender, politics, poverty, education.

reviews.author: cly__
reviews.comment_content:
The course will cover 6 main topics -
- Culture and Socialization
- Deviance
- Family and Gender
- Class inequalities
- Education
- Power and Politics

There will be quite a number of theories presented in each topic.  Make sure you have a clear understanding on each of them as well as the differences as the MCs in the exam are not as easy as you imagine.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ku's teaching is really good.  She often shares with us her personal experience, which helps us better understand the concepts.

She is really nice so feel free to discuss with her about the outline of your essay.  She will definitely give you some useful feedback.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term (35%)
38 MCs from the first 3 topics (Culture and Socialization, Deviance, Family and Gender).  There will be a few MCs from the required readings.  You will also need to study the supplementary ppt slides and memorize the distinctive features of those graphs.

Final (40%)
The exam will cover the remaining topics.  The MCs are related to the concepts and detail of those theories, and they are NOT as easy & straightforward as you imagine.  Think carefully before answering them!!

Essay (25%)
You can choose any topics you like, but it should be related to at least 1 of the topics covered in class.

In-class participation (10 Bonus Marks)
Videos will be played during class.  Then you will have 10 mins to complete a very simple question about the video.  Remember to include some concepts in your answer.

The grading is good! I just got around mean for the mid-term and nearly above 1 SD in final --> overall A-  
The grade for the essay was not released.  Though it only accounts for 25%, I think scoring high in the essay is quite important if you want to get an A range.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is not that heavy, just 1 mid-term, 1 final and 1 essay.

reviews.author: Argen
reviews.title: 社會科學大炒飯
reviews.comment_content:
如題
有6大Chapter
1. Culture and Socialization
2. Deviance
3. Family and Gender
4. Class Inequalities
5. Education
6. Power and Politics
每個Chapter會先講少少背景, 然後就講唔同派別社會學家對於果個Topic嘅睇法, 主要有Structural Functionalism, Interaction Theory 同Conflict Theory (例如Marxism), 基本上就係炒埋一碟餵你食, 然後要你逐樣材料講返出來
reviews.comment_teaching:
!留意! Agnes Ku同Groves係爭幾遠下

Agnes Ku正正常常, 會講下重點
但係上堂powerpoint唔會release, 取而代之嘅係一份雞精Notes in MS Word, 重點基本上都有cover, 用呢份野溫書都夠做

上面有人提過有上堂會輕鬆好多, 我上齊但係唔覺有太大幫助(除左attendance essay之外), 佢上堂所講嘅例子都無點係考試特別出
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Curve幾正常, 唔靚唔爛
有時上堂會播片, 播完片要寫篇short repsonse/essay, 會有分加

係呢度要講一下佢份Exam
Midterm Final全MC 無得check answer/appeal
我個人做落覺得份卷有D主觀
明明條題目問嘅野非常之簡單, 大部分option都好明顯
但係總有最後1個option係鬼死咁灰色地帶, 可以話係可以話唔係, 所以最後題題都係變2選1
而且會有Base on Video嘅題目, 感覺好似做緊DSE Listening咁, RTHK訪問左十幾人, 全部唔同睇法, 但係又要你揀一個option去代表曬佢地

就算成份卷識曬到最後都係錯成十幾題...

Midterm above mean <1 SD
Final above mean <0.5 SD
Essay交左但無出分
最後B+
reviews.comment_workload:
合理, 加埋reading都唔會話太重

成個Course得一篇~800字Essay,

Reading就比較長, 平均每個大chapter都有70/80版
不過有好多其實都係重複返lecture內容, 而exam問得嘅都係細節位, 要好認真睇先會留意到, 以正常閱讀速度好易miss

reviews.author: fongjj
reviews.title: Recommended to those who wants to understand your society
reviews.comment_content:
Before MT:
- Culture and Socialization
- Deviance
- Family and Gender

After MT:
- Class inequalities
- Education
- Power and Politics

The content is evenely distributed to mid-term and final exam. Each examination will only test you up to three topic, plus some lecture videos and supplementary readings.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof. Ku is a sociologist, photographer and a good lecturer. Her teaching is inspiring and interesting that she gave many examples with a hope to helping students to understand the concepts and theories. She talks slow to make sure to catch the ideas, and she likes to use funny gestures when she is elaborating the idea. Yet sometimes the content is somewhat boring. I was fall into sleep in-class but luckily this course provide lecture videos.

Probably, you wouldn't know your tutor well. But you can contact them by email, they are really helpful. They helped me with an urgent issue related to my essay.
reviews.comment_grading:
Both mid-term and final exam is MCQs.

Mid-term (30%): 89.3/100  Mean: 70.74/100     Stdev: 14.28/100

Final-exam (40%) :  87.1/100   Mean: 68.1/100   Stdev: 15.08/100

Essay (20%): no annocement

In-class exercise (10%): no annocement (p.s. Based on videos that played in-class, so make sure you won't miss the lesson)

Overall grade: A+

For the essay, the topic is freestyle but you have to relate at least one topic she taught. My approach is to quote as many as relevant sources to support your points.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is light. Only 4-5 In-class exercises (15minutes each)  for 13-weeks. The essay normally take 1-2 days, depending on your speed.

You can read the supplmentary readings when you are free or bored with the notes. Some MCQs are related to the readings in mid-term but will not appear in the final-exam.

Even if you attend all the lesson, I suggest you to spend couple of days to re-watch the lecture video before mid-term and final-exam as revision.

reviews.author: 燃燒中的GPA
reviews.comment_content:
6 topics about sociology:

For mid-term:
Topic 1: Culture & Socialization
Topic 2: Crime & Deviance
Topic 3: Family & Gender

For final:
Topic 4: Social/ Class Inequalities
Topic 5: Education
Topic 6: Power & Politics
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ku explains the course materials well by providing a lot of examples and her own experience. Sometimes she plays some videos, making the lectures more interesting. (Some are for class exercises, some are not.) Local students may find it easier to understand as Prof. Ku likes to use the examples in Hong Kong (e.g. Umbrella Movement, Li Ka Shing, Chief Executives in Hong Kong, etc.) for illustration. Do come to the lectures punctually as it is quite difficult to find a seat if you are late. Lecture videos are provided.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term (35%): 55 minutes during lecture time, 38 MCQs (5 options each)
(2 MCQs from required readings, 2 MCQs from videos shown in lectures, and the remaining from lecture notes and supplementary PPT notes)

Mean: 68.6/100, SD: 13.88/100


Final (40%): 1 hour 30 minutes, 57 MCQs (5 options each)
(All MCQs are based on lecture notes.)

Mean: 70.00/100, SD: 14.00/100


Essay (25%):
A sociological essay (600-900 words), due on study break


Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.):
-Answer 1-2 questions (in short paragraphs) after watching a video. Write down your name, student ID and your answers on the paper given and submit it to Prof./ TA at the end of the lecture.
-Best 3 performances out of 4 will be counted.


I got an A- with +1.12 SD in mid-term and +0.42 SD in final. I think getting at least +1.x SD in both exams is needed for an A/A+. (No scores or statistics about the essay and the bonus points were given.)
reviews.comment_workload:
For the exams, reading the lecture notes is enough. Read the required readings if you aim for an A+. The lecture notes are quite short, with 20-30 pages for each exam. (The exams are non-cumulative.) Make sure you memorize the details well, e.g. who proposed what theory, the criticisms/ unanswered questions about a theory, etc.

The workload comes from the essay. It really takes time to think of a suitable topic for the essay to demonstrate your understanding of the concepts learnt.

No attendance is needed if you decided to skip all the lectures and give up all the bonus points. Usually the class exercises for the bonus points will take place at the last lecture of a topic. You can guess the dates of those lectures according to the class schedule and just attend those lectures if you are too busy :)

(For your information only)
1st bonus (18/9): Triadization of Youth Gangs (Topic 2)
2nd bonus (11/10): The Mosuo Family (Topic 3)
3rd bonus (6/11): Poverty in Hong Kong (Topic 4)
4th bonus (29/11): People without a flat, Flats without People (Topic 6)

reviews.author: vault34overseer
reviews.title: 讀呢個course你絕對唔想亦都唔好走堂 呢個係肯上堂包高分
reviews.comment_content: 呢個係社會學嘅人門course,會簡單講吓deviance, gender, culture同family structure等嘅topic(不過family 佢講唔切).對於所有讀sosc嘅同學嚟講,就算唔諗住專攻社會學,都應該讀吓呢個course,因為社會學可以話係成個sosc基礎.佢嘅內容會幫你打破一啲固有嘅成見，喺讀其他sosc course嘅時候可以更加客觀。而且佢啲內容都好有趣好好玩。
reviews.comment_teaching: juilian絕對係shss中最好人嘅教授之一.英國人嘅純正英國口音英文你唔會聽唔明。佢講書會講得可生活化(可能係社會學嘅關係),會用到好多日常生活嘅例子。上堂氣氛十分之好,好多互動同好多時候都係笑着上堂。

reviews.author: argonma
reviews.title: 學渣嘅福音(請認明LX商標)
reviews.comment_content:
大部分都幾有意思，但係有幾part真係悶到嘔
1: 咩係sociology同預告之後教ge主題
2: Body ritual, Language, Language and gender inequality/social class inequality (好似好多詞彙其實有性別定型)
3: Thinking Sociologically About the Self, heredity VS environment
4: 用sociological同non-sociological角度講下犯罪
5: 從眾
6: neutralization(接返上面講ge犯罪，講D人ge潛意識點中和罪惡感), embarrassment, dramaturgical theory (擬劇論)
7: 宗教對社會ge意義 (看似偏向無神ge現代社會其實都有信託)
8: 自殺
9: poverty (超悶)
10: social class and mobility (更集中向香港嘅壟斷)
11: gender inequality I (更集中個由來)
12: gender inequality II (更集中個影響: 職場同屋企)
13: Family and Intimacy
reviews.comment_teaching:
唔係好知點解咁多位師兄弟姐妹都踩呢科，可能因為大家同小弟讀嘅版本唔一樣(小弟係LX, 即係self-pace版)
佢會每星期放一個module出黎，一共13 modules, 每個module 3-5個lecture(1 lecture/1 video), 每條片4-15分鐘不等，身為學渣嘅我都睇到好舒服
雖然都有D片會成條講理論，但係後面都會講返日常生活，尤其會apply返落香港，所以都幾有意思，好似講embarrasement,會先要你講自己最尷尬嘅時候(作完文先比睇片)，professor會再歸類曬你地比嘅場合，唔會淨係講理論;而一D外國嘅社會理論亦都會講返落香港ge情況，就好似上堂教ge一句:
"The sociologist’s task today is not only to see people as they see themselves, nor to see themselves as others see them. It is also to see themselves as they see other people." - Alvin Gouldner (係咪好玄)
Lecture video入面有時會直接播人地啲片，不過唔係小學etv嗰D水平，而偏係你考試前一日會係youtube搵嗰D速成片，不過更多係外國嘅social experiment, 好似如果有大火其他人唔走你會唔會走，或者要一個白人男人、黑人細路同白人女人當眾係公園偷車路人會有咩後應
總而言之，professor Groves嘅教學目標係學以致用，並且氣氛偏輕快，播嘅片都值得反思
reviews.comment_grading:
Written Exercise 20%
係兩個module入面揀一個主題寫一篇600字嘅文
Mean: 8.4/10
Mine: 7.5/10

Quiz 40%
全MC, 三次quiz棄一次最低分;呢度淨係列第二同三(因為最高分)
Format係30+條MC加一條Short question(想當LQ答都唔得，答多扣分)
MC超級straightforward，正常有睇片就答到，唔考人名地名時間，淨係考理論/一D細節(唔會考多，淨係1-3條分下高下，好似黑人定白人嘅自殺率高D，有D common sense其實答得出);不過注意上堂叫你睇(教科書以外)嘅reading會考，見有幾位師兄弟姐妹中過伏，不過其實你叫chatGPT幫你summarize重點就可以答得出(因為佢會貼埋題比你，會叫你留意一D重點，考試再照問，叫GPT幫你搵就得)
2nd Mean: 74.61/100
Mine: 71.88/100
3rd Mean: 67.24/100
Mine: 62.86/100
注意:小弟身為學渣淨係睇左一次lecture就去考，完全冇做額外野(reading都係quiz左兩次先後知後覺會考同點考)，同D話好易但係其實背後溫到熟曬嘅某D師兄弟姐妹唔同[嚴正聲明,4年黎中過好多伏:( ]，所以你只要做多過學渣少少就包mean以上(人身擔保)，同記得再懶都要睇lecture, 齋睇ppt冇用,會唔知佢做緊物

Final 50%
Format同quiz一樣，不過由頭考到尾，同多一條short question
Mean: 64.37
Mine: 71.79

Overall: B-
所以真係學渣福音，爆4嘅師兄弟姐妹想必更輕鬆
reviews.comment_workload: 好少，少到有時完全唔知自己仲有呢科讀緊，淨係考試前一兩日補曬D lecture再加一篇600字嘅文就完

reviews.author: Hot soy milk
reviews.title: Online Self-paced Easy Course
reviews.comment_content:
It covers a wide range of topics, culture, socialization, deviance, embarrassment, suicide, poverty, gender and economic inequalities.

Although the latter part of course is a little bit boring, some examples given are quite interesting and vivid, for instance how to become a marijuana users.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Although it is a purely online course, you can post any questions on the canvas discussion session which the professor would check every day.

The TA is very nice too. Before every quiz, you can attend a zoom session to raise your concerns. After the online quiz, you can check your own paper on zoom with the TA in 5 mins.

The videos are sometimes boring because of the flat tone. In general, the videos can well deliver the ideas and concepts to students.
reviews.comment_grading:
I get all the quizzes above 1 sd and end up with an A. So I am satisfactory with the grading.

The quizzes are not difficult if you go through the reading material and powerpoint slide. Pay EXTRA ATTENTION on the questions professor give on the reading material. ( They would appear in quiz or final)

Usually the question would test your understanding of concepts. Professor like giving examples to you and ask which examples best illustrate certain concepts. Of course, there would may be 1 or 2 questions require some memorisation. But all in all, if you are willing to watch the lecture video and read the material, I am sure you would be fine.
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much.

1. Three online open-book quizzes on Saturday morning (withdraw the lowest score >> only count 2 quizzes)

2. A short essay which everyone got full marks

3. A close-book f2f  CUMULATIVE final exam

You just need to go through reading and videos before each quiz and exam. It takes me around 4 days to prepare the final as I crammed for the final.

reviews.author: ilubyouboyz
reviews.title: What did I do
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge about the society and daily-life issues. Good start for UG students who are preparing themselves to jump into the society.

Family and gender
Social classes
Education
Sociological theories
Crimes and deviants
Economies
reviews.comment_teaching:
I don't usually give bad comments to prof but this prof has been really inefficient. She posted the lecture notes in word files already. In the lectures, she was just kind of reading aloud the word file in front of the slides.

She was not managing the time allocation well too, like why spending time discussing so many stuffs beyond the lecture contents. I mean, it is really ok and thought-provoking for a lecture, but it should not be too long and too far beyond the syllabus.

I tried to attend the lectures but later I gave up. Read the notes would do. Create examples for your own convenience would do. Anything would do but attending lectures.

Disclaimer 1: just opinion given according to my preferences and learning style. It may not suit you. I advise you to try attending the lectures in the first few weeks after all.

Disclaimer 2: Note to non-local students - prof would play videos of local TV programme archives and use local examples to explain the social issues. I believe these are excellent for you to understand the HK society. She welcomes you to discuss about them too.

reviews.author: 懷疑人生
reviews.comment_content:
*This is a Zoom Class*
Four big topics for this course:
Part 1 - Culture, socialisation and the social construction of everyday life
Part 2 - Deviance
Part 3 - Modernisation and social structure
Part 4 - Family education and intimacy (not enough time to cover this topic)

The contents are very easy to understand. Materials covered after Midterm are basically the same as that covered in SOSC1662.
reviews.comment_teaching: Quite interesting. There would be video clips to watch instead of pure ppt. There are also some in-class activities to enhance interactions. There are a lot of breakout room activities during the add/drop period which could be a pain for introverts, but you can skip it if you do not like it as he allows 3 absences.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grade Breakdown:
Midterm 25% (I got 36/40, Mean 28.15)
Final 40% (I got 37/46, Mean 33.49)
Written Assignment 20% (I got 10/10, Mean 9.41)
Attendance 10% (Full attendance)
Class Participation 5% (I did not participate at all)

Final Grade: A-

Midterm and Final are not hard, 2 short answer questions + MCs. You have to remember what he said in class (it could be small things that are not covered in the ppt) and pay attention to the class discussion. Make sure you read the assigned readings since there would be questions about the reading materials (just in case you did not read the assigned materials, pay attention to the class discussions regarding the readings).

Written assignment is easy, you just need to write a 500 words article. Make sure you read the requirements to understand what he wants.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is very light for a 3 credit course. Just one assignment for the whole course. Assigned readings could be long sometimes but you can simply scan through it since key points to be memorised for Midterm and Final will be discussed in class.

reviews.author: vs
reviews.title: Amazing professor
reviews.comment_content: introductory sociology course. covers gender issues, religion, family, and other fundamentals with specific focus on hong kong society, so contents are extremely applicable. the textbook is a very good resource.
reviews.comment_teaching: I sing praise about this course and SOSC 2740 (Groves' most advanced undergrad course, in terms of course number). He's a brill lecturer. Shines in huge LT lectures. He provides sound insight into fundamentals of Sociology, and is easily one of (if not the) most interactive lecturer I've yet had. One tip is to take this course (or any of his courses) at an LT.
reviews.comment_grading: the main two contributors towards final grade are the midterm and the final. grading i thought was pretty good...i participated quite a lot in class, got about 1sd above the mean for both exams, got mean on the assignment and managed an A [didn't break the A+ threshold however :( ]
reviews.comment_workload: varied, interesting, rich intro to soc. you have to attend most classes, but workload is low (midterm, final, one A4 page assignment) and exams are ez as long as you go to classes  - as long as you do, you'll be totally fine for both exams. he tends to test a lot on concepts and illustrative examples taught in class. there is some reading material (mainly out of the prescribed textbook), but not at all much.

reviews.comment_grading:
4 Quizzes (40%):
Online mode I didn't attend the class every time, but still need to spend time on the lecture notes, because even it is open-booked, but I don't think you have time to review during the quiz. Also, some are required to watch a documentary about 30-40 mins before the quizzes.

3 Reading quizzes (30%):

Choose a topic that is related to the 6 topics and discuss about it.

Grade:
All quizzes above the mean except only one, the final grade is B+.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light so you have enough time to focus on the essay if you want to finish it earlier. I suggest you can find some relative news after learning each topic, it will be very helpful for you find out which topic might be easier to write.

reviews.comment_content:

Culture & Socialization
Deviance
Family & Gender
Economy & Class Inequalities
Education
Power & Politics
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching of Professor KU is pretty good. However, I still fell asleep sometime since it was a 9am course :P. She played some videos to facilitate our understanding in some of the lectures. The videos were quite interesting to watch.

One problem I had is that she wouldn't disclose the answer of the quizzes so that we never know what we did wrong unless you have a friend that got it all right. I understand she might want to reuse the questions but it did no goods to the teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
4 Quizzes (40%):
Some questions are quite tricky and only mentioned in the lecture. Therefore, pls follow all the lectures before the quiz

3 Reading quizzes (30%):
Quite easy I would say as you can basically search it during the quiz. You only need to get a rough image of what the reading materials are about.

1 Essay (30%):
Choose a topic that is related to the 6 topics and discuss about it. You only need to write about 800 words so you don't really need to dig down into the topic. Just some brief discussion is enough.
reviews.comment_workload: I would say the major workload is the essay. Since the quizzes is open-booked due to the nature of online classes, you might not need to revise that much.

Education

reviews.comment_teaching:
For a 9 am class, Professor Ku managed to make it interesting and interacting enough. (FYI, I followed the lectures through the semesters). Professor was willing to answer questions, adjust the pace of teaching, revisit the slides and give advice on the essay. Overall I would say Professor Ku is passionate about teaching and helping out students.
One more to add, the lecture slides were not uploaded on canvas, only supplementary slides, the readings and notes were available on canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Quizzes x4 --- 40%
Reading Quizzes x3 --- 30%
Essay x1 --- 30%

The quizzes are multiple-choice, based on a corresponding video shown in class the same day and the topics of the previous chapter.
The reading quizzes are also multiple-choice and closely related to the content of the corresponding piece of reading provided.
The final essay has no fixed topic assigned and therefore us students are free to write a sociological essay on any topic within 1000 words.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. Preparing for the quizzes take little time and the only assignment is the final essay.

reviews.comment_content:
INTRODUCTIONS
1. How much do you know about your own society? Sociology and common sense
2. What is sociology? Themes, People Events
PART I. CULTURE, SOCIALIZATION AND THE SOCIAL CONSTRUCTION OF EVERYDAY LIFE
1. What is culture?
How can we be less ethnocentric?
2. How to study another culture?
3. Who am I?
Socialization and the Social Construction of Reality
4. Why language matters
Culture, Language and Symbols
PART II.  DEVIANCE
1. Are law-breakers bad people? Non-Sociological Perspectives on Deviance
2. Thinking sociologically about Deviance
3. Why do good people do bad things?
4. Why do college students cheat? Normalizing Deviance
Situational Ethics and College Student Cheating.
---------------Midterm Examination----------------------
5. What is embarrassment? Deviance and everyday life.
PART III. MODERNIZATION AND SOCIAL STRUCTURE
1. What is the point of religion?
The ideas of Emile Durkheim
2. Thinking sociologically about suicide
3. What does it mean to be poor? Defining poverty.
4. Are poor people lazy? Non-sociological theories about poverty
5. Are poor people victims?  Situational constraints
6. Class Theory and the power elite
7. Gender Inequality
Biology or Culture?
Non Sociological theories about gender
8. Thinking sociologically about gender
9. Gender in the workplace
10. Gender in the home
---------Final Examination (Cumulative)------------

reviews.comment_teaching: quite good. prof explain thing clearly and the concept is not hard. you can just sit and listen. and many student will interact, ask questions becoz there are participation marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
just one short eaasy, one midterm, one final, both mc and aroung 40- 50mc, tight time limit

fair grading. i got below mean 1 or 2 marls at midterm and 3,4 marks above mean at final. and finally B.
reviews.comment_workload:
lighttttttt workload. throughout the whole semester, just one essay, one mc midterm, one mc final. there is actually one short question in midterm and final, but that is like funny question, like giving you a story and ask you something about it, like the main character is female or male.....
very light workload anyway, dont really need to do revison. if you want to get higher grade, you may need to read textbook.
btw need attendance and open camera in zoom, which is 400 student in this class!!

reviews.author: Calace
reviews.title: SOSC 1850
reviews.comment_content:
It is all about the social issues like mostly suicidal and familial issues
It is quite interesting to learn. You can feel really relaxed to learn things that are close to your society.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is quite talkative and funny
However, he spent most of the times playing videos and listening to our answers, which would be a waste of time
reviews.comment_grading: Bad grading, it chose to pull curve. And even you got great score like 9/10,  the mean is about 9.4/10, and you will sure get a very rough grade in this course
reviews.comment_workload:
mid term and final are all MC questions
The essay is a piece of cake that you do not even have to quote

reviews.author: R22
reviews.title: interesting course but normal grade
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
Part 1 - Culture, socialisation and the social construction of everyday life
Part 2 - Deviance
Part 3 - Modernisation and social structure
Part 4 - Family education and intimacy (not enough time to cover this topic)
reviews.comment_teaching:
quite interactive, many in-class activities like kahoot
show quite a lot of videos in class which would be asked in mt and final
Prof. is very nice, he would stay and answer questions after lesson
He has a nice British accent
won't easily fall asleep in his classes
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Midterm Examination
40% Final Examination (cumulative)
20% Written Exercise
10% Attendance
5% Participation

easy to get full marks in Written Exercise
ask or answer questions to get parti marks
you must turn on your camera to have attendance marks
acceptable grade but not as good as others said
reviews.comment_workload:
quite low actually, only one assignment, mt and final
mt and final are all mc with 1-2 short questions which would cover the readings, part of the textbook and videos shown in class.
jotting notes is a must coz what he taught might not appear in his ppt and he would release the ppt after the lesson so u can refer to the ppt during the lessons.
questions in mt and final would be asked in great detail so study every single word in the readings

reviews.author: Ics
reviews.title: Online course
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
1. Culture
2. Deviance
3. Modern life
4. Family and intimate relations [not really covered due to time constraint]

It is quite down-to-earth and I think it is interesting.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Groves is nice and will stay after class to answer questions. There are also some class activities and discussions during lectures, so lessons can be fun and not too boring.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% Midterm Examination
40% Final Examination (cumulative)
20% Written Exercise
10% Attendance
5% Participation

You have to turn on cameras and speak up to gain the points in attendance and participation. For me, I did not really answer the questions. But mid term and final not too bad, so the grade is acceptable. I think it's fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
One mid term, One final and One written assignment.

Workload is not too heavy. The written assignment does not require many words, but there are quite a lot readings for me. Some main points will be mentioned in class, so you can take a glimpse and get the general ideas first. The frequency of having readings depends on the speed of teaching.

But as the final is cumulative, you may have to spend some more time to revise the things before mid term.

reviews.author: anonymilktea
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
About Culture, Deviance, Class inequalities, Power and politics. Due to the progress, the family part is excluded.

The content is interesting if you like socialology.
reviews.comment_teaching: Good
reviews.comment_grading:
Only Mid and Final, 2 exams.
For this term, due to COVID19, if you get around mean I think you can get around B- to B.
If you get mean for midterm, and 1SD above for final with full participation points, you can get A.
If you want to get a high grade, participate more in the class. The essay counts 20%, most of the people got 9-10, mean around 9.5.
reviews.comment_workload: Need to read a lot. if you don't like reading, don't take this course for sure.

reviews.author: cyanskyy
reviews.comment_content:
Before MT:
- Culture and Socialization
- Deviance
- Family and Gender

After MT:
- Class inequalities
- Education
- Power and Politics
reviews.comment_teaching: good, state content clearly, willing to help student to write their essay
reviews.comment_grading:
good
mid-term exam: a little above the average score
final exam:  above one sd
attendance: full fill all, no missing
essay: no annoucement but i think my essay is fine just on average
reviews.comment_workload:
relatively low, midterm, final exam plus one essay and attendance
normally no need much time for this course --> a good cc to study, little time spend only need to study before exam and spend time on the essay

reviews.author: Anonymous^^
reviews.comment_content:
There are 6 topics in total:
- Deviance
- Family and Gender
- Economy and Class Inequalities
- Education
- Power and Politics

Quite inspiring and interesting. However, since the topics varied, they may not go deep. Mostly basic concepts and theories.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ku is a great professor. In case you are interested and want to know more about a certain topic, she welcomes all questions and discussions. And she replies email really quick. So, no worries.

Her teaching is clear. A lot of examples are given to elaborate concepts. Even if you have no prior knowledge, no worries. Most importantly, it’s not dull.

Also, for assignments, she gives feedback to our work. So you know how you can perform better.
reviews.comment_grading:
Tasks (60%) and Essay (40%)
There was supposed to be 6 tasks but end up amended to be 5.

Full marks of tasks are 10.
I got 8.5, 7, 8.5, 8, 7 in the 5 tasks.
And essay 33/40.
Final grade: A-

I think the grading is not bad.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy at all. Just 1 essay and 5 tasks. Some of the tasks are take home exercise, while some are pop-up. If you do listen to her lecture, it’s not gonna be a big problem.

You can decide the essay topic on your own. So you can write something you are interested in, rather than forced to write something. I think this helps lower the burden. At least I find it fun to write something I’m interested in. Though it may be a little ambiguous if you are a person who needs sample to follow. Because she grants us a lot of freedom on essay.

There are some reading materials provided. But they are not compulsory. Just for your better understanding.

reviews.author: tingtingo_O
reviews.title: Good grade with little workload
reviews.comment_content:
The course will cover 6 main topics, which includes:
- Culture and Socialization
- Deviance
- Family and Gender
- Class inequalities
- Education
- Power and Politics
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Ku's teaching is nice. Although the course content itself is somehow boring, she tries to incorporate vivid examples and videos in order to make the lectures more relaxed.

She is also well prepared and willing to answer student's questions during the lecture. Also, it is also nice for her to send us a reminder for the lectures with topic-based learning tasks prior to the lectures, in case you skip the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Original assessment method:
6 Topic-based learning tasks 60% (10% each)
Essay 40%

At the beginning of April, the professor announced she would cut one of the topic-based learning tasks (i.e. each task will now account for 12% of the final grade) in order to reduce the workload and gives us more time to prepare on the final essay.

My score:
Learning task 1: 8.5/10
Learning task 2: 7/10
Learning task 3: 8.5/10
Learning task 4: 9/10
Learning task 5: 8/10
Essay: 31/40

Final Grade: A-
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not heavy. Basically, you just refer back to some concepts mentioned in the class and linked it to the video example to finish those topic-based learning tasks.

Unlike previous semesters, there is no bonus mark this semester. So, many people skip the lectures expect those with topic-based learning tasks, which the dates of these lectures are provided in the course syllabus.

reviews.author: sabsabsab
reviews.comment_content:
Topics themselves are quite interesting, this course teaches a lot about the theories behind the different interesting social phenomenons.
The course covers:
1. Culture
2. Deviance
3. Modern Life
4. Family and intimate relationships
reviews.comment_teaching: I think the professor sometimes can't really address all students' studying needs. Sometimes he had discussions with specific one of two students, while the rest of the class probably can't understand the contents of their discussion. he also likes to upload a almost-empty powerpoint AFTER CLASS, which makes me hard to jot down the notes. (but if you don't jot down the notes i can guarantee you'll get a very bad result for your midterm and final)
reviews.comment_grading: I think the grading system is not really good, feel like all my hard work is not really paid off. I got both midterm and final almost 1sd higher, and my essay almost full mark (9.5 out of 10). but the thing is the professor is too generous in giving out marks for the essay, the average is like 9.3 out of 10.
reviews.comment_workload: I think the workload is fair enough. One midterm, one essay, and one final. (both midterm and final questions are mostly MC questions with 2-3 short questions)

reviews.author: Ccw
reviews.comment_content:
Topics:
- Culture and Socialization
- Deviance
- Family and Gender
- Class inequalities
- Education
- Power and Politics
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ku teaches so well that she can elaborate every detail for each topic clearly and with many examples. She will upload a word file for each topic which contains the teaching material to be tested and use her own ppt to elaborate the theories in class (but she won't upload those ppt). Not much elaboration is included in the word file. Therefore, it would be better if you can attend lessons and make notes on them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid Term - 35%
-all mc
-First 3 topics and all teaching material mentioned in class (e.g. Video, supplementary notes)

Final - 40%
-all mc
-Remaining topics and all teaching material mentioned in class (e.g. Video, supplementary notes

Essay - 25%
-Topic of essay: 6 topics taught in class or other topics

In-class participation - extra 10 Marks
- about 3-5 in-class exercises.
-Prof. Ku won't tell you when the in class ex. would be held and the ex. are usually held at the end of the lesson. Just write a small passage expressing your opinion towards the video watched during lesson with knowledge mentioned in class.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light workload!! Overall just need to hand in an essay at the end of the semester and revise for the mid term and exam.

reviews.author: 科大男神
reviews.title: Easy course if you are ok with sociology stuff and memory
reviews.comment_content:
6 topics that include sociological perspectives and theories, and some real-life examples for illustration.

1. Culture and Socialization
2. Deviance
3. Family and Gender
4. Class inequalities
5. Education
6. Power and Politics

Not that useful in real life, but quite interesting to understand society in different perspectives.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof KU is very kind that she provides a set of detailed notes on all the topics. You can get most of the ideas by simply reading the notes.

Still, attending lectures is useful as she sometimes gives intriguing real-life examples that really help you to better understand the materials and connect the theories to your experiences. Lecture videos are provided but there are random class exercises that count for bonus marks.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term (35%)
Covers topic 1-3. 38 MCs, 2-3 are from the readings.
Mean: 70.74/100
SD: 14.28/100

Final (40%)
Covers topic 4-6. 58 MCs, none is from the readings.
Mean: 68.1/100
SD: 15.08/100

Essay (25%)
No definite instructions. You are welcome to write anything but in a sociological perspective. Results are not disclosed, I believe effectively using concepts mentioned in class will help. You can also consult prof KU but do so earlier.

Class exercises (bonus points)
Short question on a video played in class. 4 exercises in my semester. Best 3 performances out of 4 will be counted.

I got 1.3 sd above mean in both the exams, but I think my essay was just fair. I got a A, which I think it's not bad.

(my friend got 0.6sd above in mt and 1.1sd above in final and got a A-)
reviews.comment_workload:
Not much. Readings are quite a lot so only do those if you want a A+;)

For the exams, the better you recite the notes, the higher you score. Besides memorizing, better recap the examples mentioned in class cause they might be tested.

The 600-900 words essay will probably take you 1-2 days.

reviews.author: whatsgood
reviews.comment_content:
1) Culture & Socialization
2) Deviance
3) Family & Gender
4) Class Inequality
5) Education
6) Power
reviews.comment_teaching: A lot of exercises during lectures which can enhance your understanding of the topics.
reviews.comment_grading:
The midterm and the final is pretty easy so the mean is usually adequately high.
Try to be really creative in your essay to get higher marks.
reviews.comment_workload: Just watch the lecture videos and review the slides before the quizzes. 2 to 3 questions are based on the additional reading materials but the professor will go through some of it in his lectures. Essay is just a creative writing on one of the topics.

reviews.author: mercy
reviews.comment_content:
week 1: How much do you know about your own society? What is sociology?

week 2: What is culture? How can we be less ethnocentric? How do you study another culture?

week 3: Why Language matters

week 4: Are law breakers bad people? Non-Sociological Perspectives on Deviance. Thinking sociologically about deviance.

week 5: Why do good people do bad things? What is embarrassment?

week 6: Why do we need religion and understand suicide.

week 7: What does it mean to be poor?

week 8: are poor people victims?

week 9: Have women now achieved equality with men? The facts of inequality. Biology or culture?  Biological explanations of gender differences

week 10: Why sexist language matters?

week 11: why can't we find true love? why are there so many divorces these days?

week 12: how has family changed?
reviews.comment_teaching: Groves is an extremely experienced professor who is able to explain complex sociological concepts in a very concise way. He occasionally shared his personal experiences and actively invited students to speak their minds on different issues, which enabled us to gain different perspectives.
reviews.comment_grading:
midterm: 25%
essay: 25%
final: 50%

I got around mean in the midterm, which was something like 68%. Then i got 10/10 for the essay and 93% for the final. I eventually got an A-
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was extremely light. All you need to do is to keep up with the additional readings and those assigned textbook readings. On top of that, you'll need to pay attention in class as well as he likes asking questions related to the in-class discussions. But lecture videos are available so don't worry if you miss any class.

reviews.author: Caspar chan
reviews.title: This course is quite interesting.
reviews.comment_content: It's all about thinking as a sociological way. There are mainly four areas that will be covered throughout the course: culture, deviance, modernization, and social structure and family and intimacy.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor tries to engage everyone in the lecture hall. He uses a lot of questions to push us to think. There are some social experiments done during the lesson which also relate to what he is trying to teach. I am into such kind of teaching style but I know some of the students does really like it. He also uses quite a lot of documentaries or video to facilitate his own teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is wonderful for me. I think it's fair grading. It depends on whether you can score high in midterm and final. For the essay part, I think the professor or TA just randomly gives you a score which pissed me off.
reviews.comment_workload: There is one essay, one midterm and one final. It really depends on what grade you wanna score. If you wanna score high for the midterm and final, you should read all the additional reading and textbook. In that case, the workload can be very huge.

reviews.author: Angel1ca
reviews.title: One of the most enjoyable common core courses in ust!
reviews.comment_content:
Covers a wide array of basic concepts in sociology in a way that's very easy to grasp. I think a few of the topics are a bit boring, but most are interesting and eye-opening for most people.

The lectures are recorded. Lecture notes and other materials are uploaded on canvas, the textbook is available on reserve in the library.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor encourages in-class participation and is very open to questions and comments! Both the professor and TAs are also very responsive via email. The class meets once a week for 3 hours, with 2 10 min breaks inbetween. but because the lectures involve a lot of in class exercises, it didnt feel like 3 hours!

However, sometimes the professor focuses only on one side of the classroom when asking questions so it narrows down ur opportunities of participating in class. especially if ur shy.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% - Written Assignment
25% - Midterm
50% - Final
Bonus score of up to 10 points for participation

Overall it's good grading and appropriate grade cut off i think. I got 95/100 for midterm, 92.59/100 for final, and 9/10 for written assignment (below average). Got an A+
reviews.comment_workload: Not a lot of work. There are readings each week and they can be pretty long, but I think most people choose not to do them. I think u can still get a decent grade even without doing the readings since most of the reading material is discussed in class.

reviews.author: rara
reviews.comment_content:
the content is fun and easy to understand
but not very useful to be honest
reviews.comment_teaching:
personally,  the teaching is good and clear
but have to follow professor's rules (no laptops and phones)
reviews.comment_grading:
but then the grading is quite bad
very competitive due to the easy content
have to be very careful with the MCs
for the essay, its very easy to score high if you follow professor's instruction (got 10/10 for the essay)
reviews.comment_workload:
workload is average
only one essay, one mid term exam and one final exam
no attendance required

reviews.author: Brian2016
reviews.title: GOOD COURSE BUT BULL CRAP GRADES
reviews.comment_content:
PART I. CULTURE, SOCIALIZATION AND THE SOCIAL CONSTRUCTION OF EVERYDAY LIFE
What is culture?
How can we be less ethnocentric?  
Who Are you? Socialization and the Social Construction of Reality
Why language matters?

PART II.  DEVIANCE
Are law breakers bad people?
Non Sociological Perspectives on Deviance Thinking sociologically about deviance.
Why do good people do bad things?
Obedience to Authority
Normalizing Deviance, Situational Ethics and College Student Cheating.
What is embarrassment?

PART III. MODERNIZATION AND SOCIAL STRUCTURE
Why do we need religion?
Understanding suicide. Anomie and Suicide
Some Facts About Poverty.
Class Theory and the power elite
Have women now achieved equality with men?
The facts of inequality Biology or culture?
Why sexist language matters
Social Representation of Women in the Media

PART IV: FAMILY EDUCATION AND INTIMACY
The Romantic Love Ideal and the search for intimacy
Why are there so many divorces these days?
How has family life changed?
reviews.comment_teaching:
prof is surprisingly interesting, he did put effort into the course every time
+ lecture video is provided
reviews.comment_grading:
Almost 1 sd above mean for both FINAL AND MIDTERM
9/10 for Essay but mean is 9.3.....
Overall B grade....
maybe I didn't raise my hands enough during the lecture and the prof couldn't recognize me.  (There is an additional 10% bonus mark for this part)
reviews.comment_workload:
Almost no workload for the whole course
Midterm-term
Final
A one page Essay
(There will also be reading materials for most of the lectures)

reviews.author: 販冰兵
reviews.title: 細節分高下
reviews.comment_content:
呢科係個入門Course，咁顧名思義 教嘅嘢都唔會太深，大部分都好似好Common Sense，唔會太難明嘅。 佢一開始會講下嗰啲乜嘢文化社會呀嗰啲議題，跟住midterm之後就會開始講家庭愛情嗰啲嘢。 大部份都係一啲聽完之後會“哦~”，然後覺得幾得意嘅嘢。

只不過但係佢嘅notes好亂好散，所以我建議你一定要上堂。而且大部分考試考嘅嘢都喺堂上面會講過，所以基本上你專心上堂都唔會考得太差。
reviews.comment_teaching: 可能係因為係鬼佬Professor， 佢上堂都算係風趣幽默，又有純正嘅英國口音，所以上堂都唔會太悶。其實佢都幾好人嘅，每堂都有好多時間畀大家問問題同一齊討論，又好Approachable。
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm Exam：25%
Final Exam：50%
Written Assessment：25%

雖然佢上堂話唔鍾意考大家背嘢，但我覺得其實考試內容都會問幾多佢上堂講過嘅嘢（咪即係背🤷） 而考試就主要考你讀佢嘅嘢讀得有幾仔細，所以盡量上堂同埋要抄Notes。

我一開始都覺得有少少難捉摸，所以midterm考得好差（我57/100，Mean 68/100，SD=14）。而我Final大概72/100（Mean 71/100，SD=14），加上Writing Assignment滿分（其實Mean係9/10 Lol），最後B-，好唔好grade就見仁見智啦。
reviews.comment_workload:
呢科基本上冇嘢做咁濟。

淨係Sem中會叫你作一篇大概五百字嘅文，而且個ta都好似係亂改嘅。又無其他功課。所以平時真係冇嘢做好輕鬆。

但係整體黎講都好有趣，解釋左好多社會現象
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Ku既教法幾好~簡單直接，會比好多example同埋自己既經歷我地參考，令到我地更加明個concept
佢唔會provide個ppt，但係就會整份notes比你，基本上再jot返佢講既例子就ok~但係建議一定要睇lecture video！因為concept會清好多，同埋佢d例子幾生動，記得入腦好多！
reviews.comment_grading:
我覺得都幾fair，我midterm 同final高1.5-2 sd 最後攞A
因為果日得一堂，所以基本上無上過堂，會抽4堂出黎睇in class video然後take attendance，最後三堂會加bonus，但係我剩係撞正兩堂有上到~
assignment就唔會知自己幾多分
midterm同final都係MC題，主要係考concept清唔清，因為佢會四個option都好類近，但係其實只要有睇lecture video佢都基本上解釋得好清楚！
extra reading好似剩係midterm出過一兩題，final無出到，我都無睇過
reviews.comment_workload:
要寫一份600-900字，關於社會現象同自己既assignment，題目自己定，但係解釋既社會現象要可以link得返去教過既野
果陣覺得其實反而咁先難，唔知寫咩好，果陣deadline前一日先嘔到出黎，中途仲轉過題目添
不過我覺得定完題目之後問下prof其實應該好d，因為我見其他人問佢會比好詳盡既解答，同埋方向都應該會清晰好多

reviews.author: Hsu
reviews.comment_content:
Basic knowledge of sociology, introductory course to sociology. Teaches concepts, theories and views in several topics (poverty, social segregation, inequality, education etc.) and famous sociologists.

A very interesting course for students who likes to explore how our society works.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Things are straight forward and simple, though some of the concepts presented by professor Ku were thought provoking.

Professor Ku played few clips from movies, documentaries which i thought was very interesting, some of them were around 10mins while some were as long as an hour.

Professor Ku would organize and explain questions asked by students on canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm: a little bit below mean, definitely within 1 SD.
Exam: Below 50%, definitely below mean by a lot.
Essay: ?
In class short questions: ?
Grade: C+

Surprised didn't get a D, very generous grading in my opinion.
reviews.comment_workload:
Both midterm and final are MCs, and the only essay should be under 1000 words. Short questions are for additional scores, not mandatory.

Materials are easy and quite straight forward, few pages of notes for every topic. Over 100 pages of reading, no tricky things. Few MCs are based on readings.

Should be easy to get a B compared to SOSC 1270 international law :)

reviews.author: xin1
reviews.title: A worth-taking course
reviews.comment_content:
the first two courses in the add&drop period is the introduction part, which is mainly about the sociological imagination.
and classes before the midterm covers culture and socialisation, deviance, family and gender. after midterm is about class inequalities, education, power and politics.
There will be several lecture videos at the end of some classes, although they will be followed by class exercises for checking attendance.
reviews.comment_teaching: pro ku's class is very intriguing, she'll explain those theoretical stuff clearly by simple examples. and there are plenty of interactions between students and professor.
reviews.comment_grading: i forgot the statistics for exams. but the mid term and final are all MC, and the final short essay's grading is relatively fair.
reviews.comment_workload: the required reading is a little bit heavy but it only consists about 10% of the exam( according to the syllabus). it will be enough to be above mean if you listened to the lectures and digested the lecture notes, and lecture videos are available on canvas.

reviews.author: sr71
reviews.comment_content: 呢個course算係sosc嘅入門 內容cover 男女平等 教育 權力 政治 家庭等等 涉獵範疇都幾大 但都唔算難明 而且好多幾都值得聽吓 特別係講資本主義嗰part
reviews.comment_teaching: 我覺得PROF都教得幾好幾認真 講嘢都算幽默 上堂會俾好多本地例子幫你理解 個人建議想拎A RANGE 最好堂堂上足 一嚟係佢會考堂上講過嘅嘢 二嚟齋睇佢啲NOTES 係無可能會明啲CONETENT
reviews.comment_grading:
MID-TERM + FINAL 全MC
兩次嘅MEAN同SD都差唔多
MEAN 大約係 ~70/100
SD ~ 15

我MID TERM ABOVE ~1.5 SD
FINAL ABOVE ~2 SD
ESSAY 就無出分
最後 A+
reviews.comment_workload:
極低WORKLOAD 全個sem得一份 essay 要交 而且只需要600-900字 題目自由發揮 但要同social science有關係 essay嘅要求都幾特別 唔一定要非常formal 同客觀 prof 反而鼓勵大家分析同寫吓自己嘅個人經歷 不過都要關social science事啦 同埋最好加埋上堂教嘅concept

READ MATERIAL 就可睇可唔睇 MID TERM 都係得幾題會問 FINAL 直情無 不過想拎A RANGE 最好睇埋 可以幫你更清潔理解到啲concept

reviews.author: Law~
reviews.title: Very Good SSC-SA (so far the best)
reviews.comment_content:
It is a course featuring introductory sociology. The content covers from Crime & Deviance; Family & Gender; Social Inequality; Education and Stratification; and finally Power & Politics.

There are different classical and contemporary theories regarding sociology of different institutions. It provides all-rounded sociological insights to students in the course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very Good Teaching -- The ideas are clearly expressed and illustrated with examples and some videos.

Many of the videos shown in class are adopted from RTHK HK Connection (鏗鏘集), or other TV Programs commonly watched by HK-ers. Local Students will find it especially easy to understand :D
reviews.comment_grading:
I was few marks higher than mean in Mid-Term Examination and 1.5 S.D. higher than mean in Final Examination. Essay Score was not released. I attended the classes with in-class exercises (missed one). Final Grade => A and I can say that is totally out of my expectation!

Despite the generous grading policy that I believe Prof. Ku should have adopted, Essay Writing should have played vital role in determining final grade according to other reviews on this course (for Prof. Agnes Ku Session).

The key to success in this course is that you need to have the "Sociological Imagination" which Prof. has mentioned in the first class - It is the ability to relate personal issues (goods or misfortunes) to a wider societal level. This ability applies more significantly to the content after Mid-Term Examination.
reviews.comment_workload:
Major Workload:

1. Attend 3/4 Lectures with In-Class Exercises (featured with video)
2. Attend Mid-term Exam which is conducted in class
3. Attend Final Exam in December
4. A 1000-word Sociological Essay in which you can decide the topic and scope of writing

If you miss the lecture, you can refer to the lecture videos uploaded 1/2 days after the lecture. The exam questions are set mostly based on Lecture notes and Video Content shown in class. A relatively small percentage of questions are set based on Reading Materials.

reviews.author: gpaover4
reviews.title: a good course
reviews.comment_content:
The course covers some fundamental concept of sociology, focusing on the deviance, family, Gender, economy&class inequalities, education, and power&politics.
Prof Ku would focus on a number of the specific area on one chapter and further elaborate it.
I found it quite interesting.
More importantly, the content is easy to understand.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Ku is such a good lecturer.
It is easy to follow the lecture.
And the lecture content will be uploaded to canvas.
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term 35%
exam 40%
essay 25%
class discussion 10%(bonus point)
Both Mid term and final exam above ~1.5s.d
But I am poor in writing the essay.
I finally got a-.
I think it is quite fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
quite low.
The essay is around 600-900words.
And the exam and mid-term are only mc questions.
This means you don't have to remember every wording on the notes. But you have to understand the notes a little bit deep. (the mcq is kind of tricky. if u don't understand the concept quite well, you will feel very confused in the examinations.

Hope everyone get a satisfactory grade in this course

reviews.author: catlovers
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting topics covered. Mainly centered around social problems that shaped society into modern form. Topics like deviance, family, inequality, power, education are included in the syllabus.
occasionally some video exercises that count as bonus marks
reviews.comment_teaching:
Rather slow, well spoken English, clear enough
shes a friendly prof who is willing to explain the topics to you bit by bit
reviews.comment_grading:
mid term: 70 something above 0.5 SD
Final: below 1 SD
essay: A-
Final grade: B-, Not so fair but the final is gonna be more tricky
all MC, final: 50-60, mid term 40 questions
she will ask some questions from the compulsory reading materials, you should read them before taking the exam
reviews.comment_workload: a 600-900 word essay(citation not included), took me a week to finish it, better do  it asap. No clear guideline is given so its a free-style essay. Just discuss a social issue or your family from a sociologist point of view. MUST include sociological terms like social theories and citations to support. You can always as the instructor some questions.

reviews.author: Vivian LWL
reviews.comment_content:
Topic included:
Culture& Socialization
Crime and Deviance
Family and Gender
Social/ Class Inequalities
Social Stratification & Education
Power and Politics

Both lecture note and extra readings are given.

No attendance requirement
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching.
It is interesting and she will share many examples.

If you miss one lesson, you can watch the lecture video.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid- term exam (35%)
Final exam (40%)
Essay(25%)
Class Exercise(10 bonus points max.)
reviews.comment_workload:
Only need to study before mid-term exam and final exam.

For essay, you are required to write a sociological essay with any topic about yourself, your family or a social phenomenon. Length of essay is 600-900 words.

reviews.author: yukkkk
reviews.comment_content:
Before Midterm:
Topic I: Culture & Socialization
Topic 2: Crime and Deviance
Topic 3: Family & Gender

After Midterm:
Topic 4: Social/ Class Inequalities
Topic 5: Social Stratification & Education
Topic 6: Power and Politics
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ku's class is so vivid and interesting. Some video clips are shown during the lesson and sometimes you are required to do a short class exercise about the videos. (its just a short question and the class exercises are for you to receive the bonus points on top of your total course score)
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam 35%
Final exam 40%
Essay 25%
Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.)

Exam Format: All are MC, including a few questions asking for application, required readings and the video clips shown in class

Most of the questions are related to the contents of the lecture notes. (the required readings are to help you understand the lectures better)

If you can clarify and memorize the theories well, its not hard to obtain a good grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
one midterm + one final + one short essay (600-900 words)

Essay is a free topic assignment (about yourself, your family, a friend you've interviewed or a social phenomenon)

reviews.author: non-workaholic
reviews.title: A good choice for CC
reviews.comment_content:
Mid-term Exam:
Culture and Socialization
Deviance
Family & Gender

Final Exam:
Class inequalities
Education
Power & Politics

Both mid-term and final exam contain MCs only, and they are all non-accumulative.

All lessons are recorded as lecture videos and there will be class participation mark calculated.
reviews.comment_teaching: A passionate instructor which explained the concept of the course well. Her lessons are interesting and fruitful, sometimes there will be videos played in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term exam (35%)
Mean: 68.6/100
Stdev: 13.88/100

Final exam (40%)
Mean: 70.00/100
Stdev: 14.00/100

Essay (25%)

Attendance (by doing some class exercises) (Bonus marks)
reviews.comment_workload: Not much workload except for the essay which will be submitted at the end of the courses (Dec1) before the final exams, and there are some required readings for us to read. They are quite long but informative.

reviews.author: Emerald
reviews.title: Good course
reviews.comment_content:
total 6 topics:
-Culture and Socialization
-Family and Gender
-Crime and deviance
-Power and Political
-Education and Social stratification

Not hard to understand as long as you attend the lectures
reviews.comment_teaching:
Detailed explanation
likely to explain each theory with examples and applications
and there were lecturer videos provided
reviews.comment_grading:
Quite good grade. I've got both 1sd above in the mid-term and final exam and finally got an A-. The essay mark was not shown.
There were also class assignments with bonus marks given.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light!!! Only 1 mid-term (MC), 1 Final exam(MC) and 1 short essay.

reviews.author: grqm
reviews.comment_content:
Before midterm:
Culture and socialization
Deviance
Family and gender

After midterm:
Class inequalities
Education
Power and politics

Some of the topics are quite relevant but I think some of those sociological "theories" that attempt to explain society are too arbitrary. Unfortunately this course was all about memorising those theories.
reviews.comment_teaching: I only went to the first lecture and found it boring. It could be because I am never really interested in sociology.
reviews.comment_grading: Surprisingly good. I got an A- with only mean in the midterm and 0.6 sd above mean in the final. And I didn't even go to class (so no bonus points for me).
reviews.comment_workload:
Exams were easy to prepare (multiple choice questions only) and required only memorisation.

The essay could take up to a day to write.

reviews.author: younowho
reviews.comment_content:
Mid-term exam 35%
Final exam 40%
Essay 25%
Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.)

This course introduces you to basic sociological concepts such as deviance, gender, family, class inequalities, education and politics.

The professor will post the lecture notes all in word format onto Canvas before lectures. Every class, she would elaborate the points. Sometimes, she would play videos related to the topic.

The professor was kind enough to take video of every lecture and post it onto Canvas after class. However, sometimes, 1 or 2 videos will be missing due to technical difficulties.

With that said, she took attendance by asking you to submit a short analysis of a video she played in class. She did this for around 4-5 times this semester. You are allowed to skip one of these in-class assignments.

There were readings assigned to each topic.

For the essay, you were required to write around 800 words on any topic related to the content taught in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It is a large class with nearly 400 students in LTA. Every class, the professor would just talk about the points on the lecture notes. The content was easily understandable. If you miss some points, you can refer to the video on Canvas.

Sometimes, she would ask questions. A few students may get bonus points if they answer.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term
Mean: 68.6/100
Stdev: 13.88/100

Final exam
Mean: 70.00/100
Stdev: 14.00/100

I got around 1.5SD above mean in both Mid-term and Final Exam. The marks for the essay was not released. In the end, I got an A.

The format of the exams were all MC based. They were quite tricky. For the Mid-term, there were 1-2 questions on the readings. But for the Final Exam, I do not recall any questions that refer to a specific reading. I did not really study the readings.
reviews.comment_workload:
Light workload.

All you have to do is study for the exams and write the essay. I revised a couple of days before the exam and felt alright.

For the readings, you can choose to read them if you are interested.

reviews.author: Eunjiii

She would play videos during some classes and you can earn bonus points by answering the question given  by the professor (write down your thoughts and feelings towards the question).

reviews.comment_workload:
Mid-term exam 35%
Final exam 40%
Essay 25%
Class exercises/ discussion (10 bonus points max.)

※Exams take the form of MC and/ or short questions. Mid-term exam will cover the topics from the start to Family & Gender; final exam will cover the rest of the topics.1

reviews.author: USTheagod
reviews.title: a nice CC course that you can consider :)
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers six basic topics, including culture & socialization, deviance, family & gender, class inequalities, education and power & politics. The mid-term exam will cover the first three topics and the final exam will cover the remaining three topics. (remark: non-cumulative!)

For me I really enjoy this course as I can have a much better understanding on the society and many basic concepts like capitalism, marxism, structural-functionalism.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is sometimes funny and I can feel that she is excited to teach us sociology!  She often gives detailed elaboration and examples on the concepts and theories which allow me to  better understand those abstract concepts. There're quite a lot of things said by her that are not mentioned in the lecture notes so make sure you attend the class and jot some notes!( or you can just watch the video on canvas)
reviews.comment_grading:
Both the mid-term and final exams are MCQ (38MCQ in midterm and 58 MCQ in final). I was able to finish the paper quickly as the questions were rather straightforward and I think you can quickly know the answer if you have memorized and understood the theories well!

The content is quite easy and as long as you understand the concepts and distinguish between different theories (this is very important and a lot of questions are about comparison between theories and features of a theory), the exam should be easy for you :)

There're a total of 4 class exercises which require you to write a few words on certain topic after watching a video during the lecture. Bonus points will be given if you write well and please note that only the best 3 exercises will be counted so you can skip some lectures just like me xd

MIdterm: (35%)
Mean: 68.6/100
Stdev: 13.88/100
(mine:84.21, +1.12sd)

Final: (40%)
Mean: 70.00/100
Stdev: 14.00/100
(mine:87.93, +1.28sd)

Essay (25%) (no stats)

Grade: A
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite light as there're only a few pages for each topic and you can just revise them just before the exam (but make sure you memorize those theories and sociologists well!!) There's also a very short essay (500-900words) and you can write whatever you like as long as you analyze from a sociological perspective.

However, there're a lot of supplementary readings that are "required" in this course as a few questions may be asked in the exams. Note that there were really 3-4 questions that were asked in the mid-term exam but in the final exam it didn't ask any questions on that!(luckily I didn't read them xd)

reviews.author: tobytam1583
reviews.comment_content: The purpose of this course is to engage you in a conversation about how we can be more sociologically mindful in our understanding of modern life.
reviews.comment_teaching:
interactive teaching style.
and you will get extra credit if you frequently ask question in the class
reviews.comment_grading:
The Final Grade
Midterm Exam            25%
Final Exam                  50% (cumulative)
Written Assignment    25%

mid term and written assignment above 1 sd
final exam mean
finally got B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Not high workload
There are some readings you have to read before classes because he will discuss it
Attending every class is a must because the things mentioned in the class will be tested.

reviews.author: HELLO:)
reviews.title: Great sociology course
reviews.comment_content:
This course covers different topics related to sociology, e.g. culture, socialization, deviance, social structure, religion, family education etc.

There is always some interesting fact popping up in the lesson. The concept is not difficult to understand as this is related to our daily lives.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Interactive course probably as Professor Groves always encourages us to express the opinion. There are some interesting class experiments for us to participate and let us understand the sociological concepts.

If you want to have a good grade, make sure you jot down what Professor said in the lecture as well as pay attention to the videos played in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
25% written assignment
25% mid term
50% final exam
(both exams have MCs and short questions)
10% extra for class participation

Midterm exam below mean one mark
Final exam above 0.7 SD
Written assignment full mark
Eventually B+

I think more class participation can contribute to a higher grade.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is not quite heavy as you only need to read 8-10 pages of required reading. You can choose one topic out of two topics and work on it. The written assignment is quite interesting.

Get close to your textbook and required reading in order to achieve higher marks in final exam!

reviews.author: LovelyLilTroll
reviews.comment_content: This is an introductory course to sociology. It covered topics like equality, education, religion, gender...
reviews.comment_teaching: The lectures are quite interactive. Groves loves to engage students in discussion. He also prepares class experiments for us to illustrate some sociological concepts.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm exam score (out of 100):
Mean = 72.64
Median = 73.68
SD = 15.02

Final exam score (out of 100):
Mean = 73.45
Median = 75.89
SD = 14.22

The two exams are main contributors to the course grade.  I got a B for a half SD above mean in midterm and one SD above mean in final exam.

The grading system is acceptable. Just participate actively in class. Those bonus points can make a big difference.
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite low.

There are a lot assigned readings, but most of the concepts and examples are brought up in the lecture. The reading just makes it clear and enriched. So, it is not overwhelming despite the amount.

reviews.author: Sharonluiii
reviews.comment_content: Introduction to Sociology, something like gender, education, equality... As usual, common core content is quite easy, but the readings are a lot a lot a lot, get prepared.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is simply reading the powerpoint with a monotone. Actually it is quite boring, and I felt asleep in a few classes. Sometimes I can hear people snored when the professor was showing videos. Interesting thing is the classroom was full in every single lecture, so need to get there early to grab a seat.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading is simply mid term+final+essay+attendance. I attend every classes and  I was below mean for a few marks in the mid term. The final exam result is not shown, but I did not think I performed excellently. The essay feels fine for me although the mark is also not shown... At last I got a A-, which was out of my expectation.
reviews.comment_workload: Simply no assignments for the course, except an essay at the end of semester. Really light workload and I will recommend people to take this course.

reviews.author: AmberM
reviews.comment_content:
Topics were quite interesting. I enjoyed reading the provided reading materials but the amount was HUGE.

**Make sure you memorize the names of those who proposed theories....this kind of question do appear on both midterm and exam...which I ABSOLUTELY HATE.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor combined contents from the reading materials. It is important to pay attention to those details if you do not want to read it outside classes. Videos are also used in lectures.
reviews.comment_grading: Got above mean (just above one sd) for both midterm and final. Did not answer or raise any questions during lectures (this is included in your final grade). Missed one in-class activity. Slept in 80% of the classes. Scored A- at the end. But I did study for it because I enjoyed the topics.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much work to do. Just go to class, work on your short essay, go to both midterm and final exam.

reviews.author: CY
reviews.title: 16-17 Fall Good Choice =]
reviews.comment_content:
It covers the following topics:

Culture and Socialization
Deviance
Family
Gender
Social Inequalities
Economy & Class Inequalities
Education
Power & Politics

Mid-term only covers from Deviance up to Gender and Final covers the rest. Content examined in mid-term exam will not be covered in final exam.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Ku basically explains the bullet points mentioned in lecture notes in the form of ppt. She has a nice voice. But it might be boring for some who are expecting more vivid teaching approaches.
reviews.comment_grading:
Here are some statistics about the course

Mid-term examination
Mean: 28.85/41
SD: 5.88/41

Final examination
Mean: 40.60/58
SD: 7.94/58

Both mid-term exam and final exam are consisted of only MC questions. For mid-term exam, the questions focus on the content covered on both lecture notes and reading material. Whereas for the final exam, the questions focus nearly almost only on the lecture notes.

Many of the questions require understanding about concepts but some also require strong memorisation. Questions like  Who Proposes What Theory do really occur==

The statistics about the term essay are not revealed to students. Students can only know their final grade

In usual cases, getting average in both mid-term and final ensures a B.
reviews.comment_workload:
Mid-term exam      35%
Final exam      40%
Essay       25% (To be handed in after final exam)
Class exercises & tutorial discussion (10 bonus points max.)

As you can see, it is fairly light XD

reviews.author: Bravo
reviews.title: Slight Workload but Soso Grade
reviews.comment_content: Introductory course to Sociology, covering topics about gender, poverty, individual perspective, crime, religion. Emphasizing the relationship between individual and society and its impacts on individual.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor's teaching style is vivid and interactive. He always wants to engage students to discuss the class materials. He tends to play videos in illustrating his points. A few in-class activities were conducted before midterm exam to inspire students and let them learn the sociology concepts.
reviews.comment_grading: A lot of exam questions are asked based on what he mentioned in class but not in notes. A few questions are also based on the assigned readings. Most of the questions are MCs plus 2-3 short questions (really short). 10% bonus will be given to students based on how actively they participate in class discussion on activity. I think this bonus marks have big impact on the final grade.
reviews.comment_workload: The assigned readings are quite a lot and tedious. The essay is just one page long. Overall workload is fine.

reviews.author: Bobby Wong
reviews.comment_content: It is an introductory sociology course. covers gender issues, religion, family, and other fundamentals with specific focus on hong kong society, so contents are extremely applicable. the textbook is a very good resource.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor delivers the lecture in a very interesting and interactive way. You will hardly feel bored but may need to pay more attention in the lessons as he speaks quite fast. You can learn through activities or games sometimes. A point to note is the things he told in lessons will be tested. Those content will not be noted in any powerpoints/readings. So attending all lectures is highly recommended.
reviews.comment_grading:
1 midterms(25%) and 1 final(50%) and 1 essay(25%0, mid term below 1 sd, final above mean
final gread: B-
reviews.comment_workload: only one short essay (about 900-1000 words) is required. Although some readings are provide, but is just contribute little in both midterm and final. In midterm, only 2 MC questions about reading. No MC about reading in final.

reviews.author: yung
reviews.comment_content: The course teaches you the sociological phenomenon as the title suggests. I will not say the course will be very helpful if you are not a humanity student. But you can get some idea about how the world behaves or operates.
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor delivers the lecture in a very interesting and interactive way. You will hardly feel bored but may need to pay more attention in the lessons as he speaks quite fast. You can learn through activities or games sometimes. A point to note is the things he told in lessons will be tested. Those content will not be noted in any powerpoints/readings. So attending all lectures is highly recommended.
reviews.comment_grading: 2 midterms and 1 final all above mean, some above 1 sd (forgot), got an A- . I heard some classmates are not satisfied with their grade.
reviews.comment_workload: As the course was taken in summer semester, there are 2 mid terms and 1 final. No assignment or project but you have to finish all the readings.

reviews.author: sleepingbag
reviews.comment_content: The course discusses some sociology behaviour explanations and common trends in Hong Kong or the US. The contents cover gender, suicide, expressions, family, society, obedience, conformity, and many other sociology analysis.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Groves provide many examples for each topic and some of the examples may be attached to recent news and political issue. The overall experience is fantastic.
reviews.comment_grading:
There are 3 quizzes (pick top 2 to grade), one small report, and a final exam.

For quizzes, I got around 89 for my top 2 quizzes, which is like getting 4 to 5 questions wrong out of 37 questions. They are overall easy quizzes if contents are well studied.

I think everyone got pretty high score on the report. I got 10/10. I don't think grade really matters in this part. It is really interesting to write this sociology report talking about my personal perspective.

Final is exactly the same format as the quizzes. Same difficulty as what I have mentioned. Also got around 89.

Overall A.
reviews.comment_workload: There are a lot of readings that MUST BE STUDIED to nail the quizzes and the final. The quizzes and the final cover almost all of the required readings (including the textbook). But compare to other SOSC which has group project, I do think reading stuffs require less workload.

reviews.author: Bluentl
reviews.title: 如果你上唔到堂就唔洗諗
reviews.comment_content:
Content唔深，但有時要記人名/特定嘅字眼。

reviews.comment_grading:
4份Quiz都Below mean 1個sd黎講拎C算唔錯。
不過我份essay係grade as B+/A-。遮係衰極只要essay寫得唔錯，都唔驚D。
reviews.comment_workload:
2星期一個quiz，reading quiz可以用Cont + F搵keyword搵答案。short quiz就要求你多少少時間背definition+專有名詞。要認得邊個人+佢嘅theory。Example提過嘅人都要認得。
一個算psychological嘅course黎講我覺得似讀文科咁。
